utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So what brings you in here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I've had this stuffy nose for the past three days. I'm getting some yellow discharge from the nose. I can't seem to smell well. And I have had this terrible headache for the past two days as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so just to kind of get a timeline, what kind of started first?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So first, my nose was kind of stuffy. And and then I started having this yellow discharge from the nose and then I kind of lost some of my smell. And then now my head hurts. It's not even like, it's not like a headache, it's like a facial pressure

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any of these symptoms before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, never.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, have you noticed...so you said like the discharge is yellow, how much of the discharge are you having like in a day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like probably enough to fill the inside of my palm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been having any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no,  nothing like that. I did have what they thought was a viral infection a week back.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And did you recover from it, like on your own?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it went away on its own.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it was just, you just had some cold-like symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, have you been coughing at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any trouble breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any loss of sense of taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I guess loss of smell.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and did that come after the congestion or was it present before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: The loss of smell came after the congestion.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and would you say you're still pretty congested?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think so, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And has it been getting worse would you say? Or do you feel that it's getting better?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I would say it's getting worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and right now what would you say is the most troubling symptom for you? Is it that pressure in your face or is it the congestion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's the...it's the pressure in my face. It hurts.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, have you tried any medications, over the counter medications at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I tried some nasal sprays. And like decongestions but it's not really helping.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And so you've tried nasal sprays? Have you tried any of those, like nasal rinses, or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, and they don't seem to be helping.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, OK. Any recent contact with anyone who's been ill or any recent travel?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: : Yeah, I've been feeling tired.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how many days would you say you've been feeling tired for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I would say for the past three days?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you feel that, you know you're having some discharge, but do you feel that there is mucous building up and dripping down your throat or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, now that you mention it, it does feel like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you noticed at all or has someone told you that your breath might smell bad? Or have you noticed it yourself?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh gosh, I hope not, no. No one said that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah, sometimes with like mucous buildup it can affect like your breath as well. So yeah, just wondering. Any chest pain at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Constipation or diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any issues with urinating?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no issues there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your sleep or appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Well, I guess sleeping is a little bit harder now because of the pressure in my face, but other than that, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, is there anything that helps you at all that you've tried?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like just the positions of how I'm sleeping sometimes helps, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so this has been going on for, just remind me again, like the last four day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, the last three days, last three days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you have any other medical conditions at all that you've been diagnosed with in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I can think of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, so have you noticed at all any weight changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been exposed to like fumes or dust? Or how do you have any animals or pets at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you take any medications or anything regularly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, I just take some multivitamins.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you know if you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just have some, I just have some seasonal allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any previous hospitalizations or surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, actually I had my appendix taken out when I was 12.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Right, and do you have any family history of any conditions, like any lung conditions, heart conditions, any cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I know that there's some asthma that runs in the family.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you ever been diagnosed with asthma?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Where currently where do you live?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live in a house with my husband and my 3 year old daughter.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you currently smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I'll smoke a joint or two once a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, a joint or two, OK. And is that, is that just recreationally or has it been helping at all with your symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, that's just recreationally.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, yeah, so those are all the questions I had for you today. Do you have any questions at all for me?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, what was like, what do you think I have?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so from the symptoms that you're describing, it does seem more like sinus issues. There's a sinus behind your face and what can happen is if you get an infection, like all the the mucous and everything can build up and increase the pressure. That's the pressure you're feeling underneath your face.  It's because of a sinus infection most likely. And usually like, it's usually like a viral infection that can go away on its own. We usually ask patients to try the nasal rinses, and then some oral decongestents. Or have you tried any anti histamines?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so no antihistamines. It seems most likely that you have a sinus infection. It can be bacterial with the yellow discharge that you're having as well. So we can give you some antibiotics, so will give you some. Amoxicillin.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So it's only been three day since you're having these symptoms, right?  And you haven't had any high fever or anything like that? Have you measured your temperature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I haven't, I haven't, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't feel hot though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, since it's been three days, what I'm going to do is still give you some antibiotics so Amoxicillin and then we'll see like after you finish that dose how you feel. And will set up another appointment for when we can do like a phone appointment and or clinic appointment when your doses are done. Does that sound good?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah that sounds great. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, you're welcome and hopefully you feel better.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Take care.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
